summary: Marvel Studios Boss Kevin Feige Reveals Inspiration for Captain Marvel Film!
title: Marvel Studios Boss Kevin Feige Reveals Inspiration for Captain Marvel Film!
body:
Marvel Studios Boss Kevin Feige Reveals Inspiration for Captain Marvel Film!

Marvel Studios boss Kevin Feige recently opened up about the inspiration for their upcoming film Captain Marvel starring Brie Larson.

In an interview with Total Film Feige noted the film is inspired by James Cameron’s [easyazon_link identifier=”B000JNN0SM” locale=”US” tag=”boundingintocomics-20″]Terminator 2: Judgment Day[/easyazon_link].

Feige explains, “These are definitely homages to our…

View On WordPress

blog.description: Faye | 22 | UK | Collector, cosplayer and obsessor of Carol Danvers. Proud long time member of the Carol Corps.

summary: Not sure if I remembered to mention to you guys that I’ve moved into a new house and also have a new tattoo? The symbol of our...

blog.name: blessedharlot
blog.title: blessedharlot
blog.description: Queer, poly, trans anarchist seeking mystic awe and wonder, and aching for something that isn't the violence of capitalism. I've got fragments of Christianity and Zen Buddhism in me; also willing to find inspiration anywhere I can. Hardcore MCU fan but I dont find much fandom space that engages the text the way I want to, so I mostly keep out of the way. I also love rasslin.

summary: Do I know any Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel fans who have comics recs? Whats the shortest way to know the most about her comics...
body:
Do I know any Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel fans who have comics recs? Whats the shortest way to know the most about her comics life?

And by short I mean please go easy; 4 years in, its still pretty easy to get overwhelmed w the massive pile that is comics history.

blog.name: soracat
blog.title: Shiny & Chrome
blog.description:
Hello, my name is Sora.

And this is my little treasure trove of stars and screaming.

I'm a writer. I work freelance & struggle with keeping every project down. I am also a Pagan. I enjoy the paranormal, video games, books & travel.

summary: I am worried about Captain Marvel and how OP Kevin says she is. People don’t generally tend to respond well to a new character...
body: I am worried about Captain Marvel and how OP Kevin says she is. People don’t generally tend to respond well to a new character coming in out of nowhere and doing far better than any of the 50 characters they’ve been following the lives of for like 9 years. It doesn’t feel earned, and it’s generally not great storytelling.

reblog.comment: I am worried about Captain Marvel and how OP Kevin says she is. People don’t generally tend to respond well to a new character coming in out of nowhere and doing far better than any of the 50 characters they’ve been following the lives of for like 9 years. It doesn’t feel earned, and it’s generally not great storytelling.

trail.content_raw: I am worried about Captain Marvel and how OP Kevin says she is. People don’t generally tend to respond well to a new character coming in out of nowhere and doing far better than any of the 50 characters they’ve been following the lives of for like 9 years. It doesn’t feel earned, and it’s generally not great storytelling.
trail.content: I am worried about Captain Marvel and how OP Kevin says she is. People don’t generally tend to respond well to a new character coming in out of nowhere and doing far better than any of the 50 characters they’ve been following the lives of for like 9 years. It doesn’t feel earned, and it’s generally not great storytelling.

summary: Brie Larson ed Alison Brie fanno impazzire il web e nascere fanta-casting
title: Brie Larson ed Alison Brie fanno impazzire il web e nascere fanta-casting
body:
Brie Larson ed Alison Brie fanno impazzire il web e nascere fanta-casting

La bella interprete di Captain Marvel che vedremo nel film omonimo in uscita nella primavera del 2019 ha pubblicato una foto sul proprio profilo Twitter che ha letteralmente fatto impazzire il web.

Qui sotto nel post potete appunto vedere il perché. Con la didascalia “Alison Brie Larson is coming for ya“, l’attrice classe 1989 ha mostrato la propria sessione di allenamento con la star Alison Brie

View On WordPress

summary: Captain Marvel MCU Prelude Comic Book!
title: Captain Marvel MCU Prelude Comic Book!
body:
Captain Marvel MCU Prelude Comic Book!

Carol Danvers aka Captain Marvel will make her Marvel Cinematic Universe debut in 2019, but first the story leading to her appearance will be told in the Captain Marvel MCU Prelude Comic Book!

Marvels Captain Marvel Prelude #1

Add this Comic Book to your collection:

The Marvel Comics Captain MarvelMovie Prelude Comic Book is expected to release November 14, 2018. You can Pre-Order now from Things…

blog.name: davidmann95
blog.title: Not Even 50% Of My TRUE Power
blog.description: Comics guy, writer guy, Superman guy

summary: I’ve seen scans of a comic where Captain Marvel is in a city that was hit with an atomic bomb. Do you know what’s up with that...
question: I’ve seen scans of a comic where Captain Marvel is in a city that was hit with an atomic bomb. Do you know what’s up with that story?
answer:
BOYS AND GIRLS AND OTHERS, DO I EVER FUCKIN’ KNOW WHAT IS UP WITH THAT STORY. The Atomic War from Captain Marvel Adventures #66 in 1946 - collected in a book of great DC Imaginary Stories, that being where I was exposed to it - opens with Chicago dying by nuclear hellfire. Captain Marvel, the fun magical guy who fights evil caterpillars, flies to the suburbs surrounding it to help survivors, but realizes too late the presence of fallout in one of the most genuinely haunting two-panel sequences in comics courtesy of Binder and Beck.

The Captain’s recruited by the army to fight back, ultimately himself throwing a nuke at the offending nation. But by then every nation is nuking every other, and Captain Marvel is left bewildered and horrified as the last man on Earth…only to cut to Billy Batson at Whiz explaining that this was only a reenactment of what a nuclear war would look like, cheerfully reminding us that they were bound by technical limitations and that the real thing would be MUCH worse! And our questions as to how Billy’s cover wasn’t blown given this dramatization directly shows him changing into Marvel are sidelined by the sight of a family gathered around the radio, with the father reminding his children that we better not have any more wars, or we’ll all die in screaming nuclear agony.

I know I’m not the only one who’s wondered how the original Death of Superman must have fucked kids up, but at least there it was originally advertised as an Imaginary Story (even if I’m sure 1940s kids figured out pretty quickly reading Captain Marvel that this couldn’t be a real story, or else there wouldn’t be any others), and with the exception of the titular two pages, it just isn’t as savage as this is, and even its depiction of Superman’s dead body isn’t nearly as gruesome as the lifelessly slumped over people, pets, and infants seen in here. It reads like a gory black-and-white fanzine thing or unauthorized anti-war pamphlet starring a necessarily slightly off-brand version of the character (barring the last couple pages), except no, that’s really Captain Marvel by his most beloved creators and it was really officially published. I don’t know about the rest of you, but I’m absolutely willing to say this probably averted nuclear war at least once when a generation that grew up reading it came into power, because they were definitely traumatized for life by it.
